on sunday, after church, andy and i went to borders cuz i needed a magazine. i saw my old friend (from junior high) on a magazine cover! i've seen it before but it's just so weird to see someone you know on the newstand. that's all. hehe.

last night andy went out to a basketball game with my brother while i stayed home and cleaned! hehe...i just didn't wanna go. i was actually supposed to be doing some "homework" but procrastination got in the way. hmm...what else? andy bought me some stuff from sephora at downtown disney for christmas. he ended up losing his disney pass over there. thank god for nice people cuz the pass came back to us in the mail! it was a surprise to me cuz i thought andy just misplaced it somewhere at home. all i can say is that he's lucky. =) it's not like we couldn't get it replaced but andy was just trying to deny that he lost it. and what does that mean? i won and he lost! hehe...jk. i forgot to mention something about the time when justin was with us. well, he's starting to talk like his friends...or shall i say...cool people. whenever he sees something neat or cool, he'll say, "that's tight!" i was kinda shocked! so, while he was with us for the weekend, i would say that at times. he'd say, "auntie, stop saying that...you don't know how to say it right!" whoa...make me feel old huh? hehe. i'd still say it every once and a while and he finally said, "stop it...you're giving me a headache!" haha...i thought that was so funny. he really thinks i can't say it in the right context. ya ya...i guess i'm not cool anymore. the weird thing is that when andy says it, it's right! geez! =)

happy new year everyone! this year, andy and i didn't have any definite plans. actually...no one we were close to had a party so we just decided to stay home. i kinda feel guilty cuz for a long time, my mom always wanted me home for new year's. either that, or be with family. my cousin usually throws a new year's eve party...so lately, that's where i've been. there's only been 2 times when andy and i were alone on new year's eve. i called my parents sometime in the evening just to find out what they're doing. they asked if i was gonna go over there. all i said was that there is a lot of drunk drivers out there! hehe...they didn't argue! YAY! oh yeah, andy's friend was having a kick-back kind of party for new years. to be honest, i didn't wanna go. i dread the smell! hehe. andy's parent's called us and asked us if we wanted to go out to dinner. they had a card to "be our guest" at a steakhouse called morton's steakhouse of chicago in costa mesa. the card was gonna expire 12/31/03 so they just decided to give it to us. they couldn't make it cuz they were doing last minute stuff before the new year came around. i heard that place was really expensive but other than that, i knew nothing about that restaurant. i called the place to ask what time they closed and to see if they were still accepting reservations. they said that they were all booked up for the night and even if it was two of us, we still couldn't get in. so, we gave up on that idea for about 5 minutes. i just told andy that it was still worth a shot to try. if not, we'll just have dinner somewhere else. so, we just got ready really quick. we stopped by andy's parent's place to pick up the card. we got to the restaurant and it's true they were all booked...but they were still able to get us in! we didn't even have to wait. i was kinda nervous when we got to our table. i wasn't sure exactly what we'd be able to get with that card. it's not like there was a specific amount of money listed or anything at all. it basically just says "be our guest." oh yeah, another thing i was nervous about was if that card was good for only one person. andy's parents already told us that they used that card before and it was good for everything. i guess since it was written on the card, i still wasn't sure. so, our waiter came by and andy asked if the card was good. he then said just tell me what you want and i'll take care of you. hehe...i still didn't get all the questions answered. i was just thinking that we'll just have to pay for just one person if the card wouldn't cover both of us. hehe. i kinda felt ghetto too. the one thing i didn't find too attractive was that before you order, you get a menu and also the waiter would show you all the things on the menu. therefore, you see the raw meat. it's not a big deal but it just didn't do anything for me. haha. so, for an appetizer we had scallops wrapped in bacon. we also had salad. for our main entre, we both had a huge porterhouse steak. i had my meat cooked well-done. andy was dissappointed that i did that. hehe. i guess i shouldn't have done that cuz they kinda burned it. oh well. the inside was REALLY GOOD! our waiter asked if we wanted lobster to go with our steak, and we were kinda hesitant. i guess cuz i didn't know what we were covered for. the waiter just told us that we might as well!! so, then we went for it. when he said that, it made me feel better. andy and i split one 3 pound lobster. guess how much that costs? $78.00. geez! and for dessert, we had a godiva chocolate cake w/ ice cream! OH MY GOSH...it was so good! i'd actually go there just for that! hehe. we were both so surprised at how good it was. everything was actually really good but the dessert blew me away. so, we finally got the bill. GRAND TOTAL: $233.00. that was the most expensive meal i've ever had. hehe...i'm just a ghetto girl i guess. the waiter came back and we just wanted to make sure that we were on the clear. he said that everything was taken care of except for tip. and then i went on to say that i'll have another porterhouse steak! haha. oh yeah...he took our plates. andy and i didn't finish our steaks. i didn't even finish my lobster. i probably ate only half of it! i was so full. anyway, he took our plates to put it in a box. i assummed that everything was in there. when we opened up the box today, it was only the steaks. MY LOBSTER WAS GONE! that was probably worth $20! geez...what a waste. hehe. oh well. it was quite an experience to go there. it was fun.

today we had a baby shower for my bro and sisnlaw at my parent's house. overall, it was pretty good. i was just not feeling that well cuz of my cold. oh well. i was actually surprised by the amount of people that showed up. my cousins did the games for the shower...and it was so fun! i didn't play all of em but it was even funny to watch everyone play...the young people and old people. hehe. i've been so tired lately just doing last minute stuff for the party. i didn't finish the favors till about 30 minutes before the party. hehe. well, it looks like they got a lot of good stuff for the baby! CUTE STUFF! hehe. me, andy, and my aunt ended up getting them a car seat and my parents got them a stroller that also goes with the car seat we got! yeah....that's what the registered for. hehe. a lot of people are starting to say that she's gonna have a boy! is she getting ugly or what? =) andy's sister first told me that if the girl starts to get ugly during her pregnancy, she'll have a boy! my aunt said the same thing last night. she said something like.....yeah, she's gonna have a boy cuz she's getting uglier! hehe. isn't that mean? hehe. we'll see if it's really true cuz i also think it'll be a boy. 2 more months....

andy and i decided to watch passions on ash wednesday. he ended up taking a half day and got off of work around 10am. so, we watched it sometime in the afternoon. when we got out of the theater, some guy approached us, asking us questions about the movie. it turns out that he was from the oc register newspaper. hehe. i didn't put in as much input as andy did so his name ended up being in the paper. andy bought....i mean, took a few extra newspapers! hehe...so lame! after that, we went back home. i was and still am sick so i ended up falling asleep when i got home...when i was supposed to be studying. oh well. we also went to church after my class! what a religious day right! =) on friday, i spent the night at my parent's house! isn't that amazing? hehe...it's cuz i haven't spent the night over there ever since i moved into the condo in anaheim hills! i basically stayed there to help out with the party!

on friday, i went to carson to run some errands with my mom. she wore me out! hehe. we had to go to all these places to go shopping for the baby shower. finally, we were off to the mall cuz she needed to return something. well, we found some clothes (for me) and she bought em for me. i got 3 pairs of pants and 1 top! =) i haven't gone shopping for a while!! or have i?! hehe. anyway, i was hungry so i picked some food up from thai barbecue. we just went home and ate it. my aunt came over and we were just talking. i ended up seeing georgia cuz i had to give her an invitation to the party. nothing too interesting to blog about huh?! hehe. on the weekend, andy and i just stayed home. either that, or i just don't remember what we did! hehe. yesterday (monday), i had to go to carson again cuz my mom asked me to take her to see someone regarding her work related injury. she had to get her wrist operated on. well, she gave me the directions and i had a feeling it was at or pretty close to where i used to work at molina. and what do ya know? i turned into the exact parking lot! i was in awe! hehe...i kept saying things like, awww...this is where i used to park...blablabla! hehe...i know it's pathetic. when we got into the building, i had a blank mind and totally forgot what floor i used to work on! well, my mom's paper said to go on the second floor so off we went. when we got out of the elevator, i saw molina signs. that's when i realized that that's the floor i used to work on. hehe. i got kinda nervous cuz i didn't want anyone to spot me. we went downstairs and realized we went into the wrong tower. we finally got to the right place on time! i guess it takes a while to pull a file out so the attorney said to meet in another hour. so, me, my mom, and aunt decided to just hang out outside. i decided to call my old coworker, malia. she kept asking me to visit but i just wasn't sure if that was a good idea. i finally found out that my old boss (my enemy) is no longer there! i guess after hearing that, i decided to just go up and visit them! hehe. it was so nice to see everyone again. i saw my enemie's office EMPTY! =) i stayed there for about an hour just talking to malia and pshyra. i told them that i was still jobless and that i saw a few positions open up for the department...but i didn't do anything about it cuz i had my pride! i had no clue if meda, my old boss was still there. they made me feel good cuz it's like they totally understood me and they know why i did what i had to do.....LEAVE! let's just say that that department kind of looks too empty! other people got into it and fought with meda! can you believe that? i wasn't sure if the director understood what i was going through. according to pshyra, she said that she probably didn't know at the time i left but it's likely that she knows now. anyway, that visit made me feel good. andy was surprised that i actually had the guts to visit. well, i did but that's cuz meda isn't there anymore. she now works for kaiser and after being there for a few weeks, she asked the director if she can come back. so, she was gonna try to pull some strings to get meda back in. i guess marian, the director told the rest of the team and everyone was disappointed. marian wondered why and that's when it all came out. so, she never came back. after the visit, we went out to lunch at a chinese buffet. i felt like it was a waste cuz i wasn't even hungry! after that, i went home and studied for the test i'm gonna be having tomorrow!

happy belated valentine's day! andy and i decided to go out and celebrate valentine's day friday instead of saturday...which was friday, the 13th. hehe. we just had dinner at that buffet at pala casino. after that, we decided to gamble a bit! i lost! thank god i usually don't gamble with a lot of money! =) i really just don't want to be like me dad! he's a gambling addict! sometimes my friends would ask me if i want to play cards or whatever and usually i don't! if i do, i feel weird! the following day, saturday, andy went to his parent's house to help his dad work on their backyard. i basically stayed home. i'm working on the favors and invitations for my bro's baby shower. after andy got back, we went to carson to visit my parents and my other cousins. my cousin and i were talking for a while about the shower while the other kids were watching lion king 1.5. after our talk, i was able to watch the movie...at least parts of it! it was so funny! i wasn't that much of a big fan when the first lion king came out. that's why i was so surprised at how funny i thought 1.5 was! i wanna get that movie. it's on sale right now at walmart...but they were sold out at the one i went to. =(
what's up with the quizno's commercial? it's so irritating. it's just making me think that they have rats/mice! yuck!

andy had the day off today! sometimes i go on those websites to try to get tickets to a talk show. so far, i went to wayne brady's show with vanna white and mandy moore. well, i noticed that britney spears was going to be on the ryan seacrest show. so, i printed out the ticket and andy happened to have the day off...so off we went! the paper said to be there by 10:30am. we ended up leaving the house around 8:15am. it was traffic---y but we still made it in time! well, the whole area was crowded. even if i had a reservation, we still weren't able to get in. i was kinda sad but i was just trying to figure out a way to just stay in the outdoor courtyard since that is a public place. people go shopping there. it's not like they're gonna shut the stores down just cuz britney spears was there! there were so many security people there making sure you're just not standing around...unless you're in a designated place. we were even thinking of just having coffee at starbucks for a few hours! hehe. basically, i just didn't wanna feel like we went there for nothing. we were able to kind of watch the band and the dancers rehearse. well, andy and i decided to just walk around hollywood. kiisfm was also there. after about 15-20 minutes of not knowing what to do with the situation, i decided to just pass by the main stage and then just leave after that. so, we were walking on our merry way. we started to hear the band play again...but this time i noticed that the crowd was a little more louder. all of a sudden, we heard britney's voice. she performed the whole toxic song and we were able to see it........well, sort of. it was just really crowded. she was doing a sound check. who would've known you have to basically camp out the night before just to see britney. i certainly didn't...and i don't know if i'll ever do that. at least we were able to see her rehearse! hehe. after that, andy and i just went driving around in hollywood. we also had lunch at todai. it was yucky. a lot of things were cold! oh well. i still had a fun day! =)

saturday, i went to a volunteer training thingy for the organization that i will probably volunteer for. it was from 1pm to 5pm. i was dreading just thinking about going but it was actually fun! and i learned a lot!! before i left for the training, justin called us to ask us if we can go to his basketball game. actually, we weren't home at the time so he left a message on the machine. afterwards, he talked to andy and i guess andy couldn't go cuz he had to do some stuff.......andy said that justin seemed disappointed. =( but i guess that's where we're going next saturday. on sunday, my brother had a little get together at his house for superbowl. did i watch the game??? NO! haha...i'm not into it. i didn't even watch the commericals. the only thing i saw was the half time show with janet jackson's boob! haha. otherwise, i was just busy playing with the kids. they are so much fun! we were also able to discuss the baby shower for my bro and sis. we had to either have it a little earlier or really really close to her due date because my mom will be in philippines for a while. so, yeah, it'll be feb. 29. she's not even due till may. oh well. well, there's nothing really to blog about....bye!

how dumb am i? i went to santa ana college to go to class today! oops...it was tuesday and my class was on monday. that means i missed it! so dumb. oh well. since i was in santa ana, i decided to go to my bro's house to drop off the invitations. that was by-far the most complicated invitations i've ever worked on. there's just a lot of cutting and glue-ing involved. but i guess i like it. it's a diaper shaped invitation. anyway, i called melani to ask if i can come over but they were on their way out to lamaze class. she said that i can come over anyway to just hang out since i have the key to their house. so, that's what i did. i had to run a few errands on the way over there and even got food from the loft. i got there right before 8pm...right on time for american idol! hehe. vanessa ended up calling me so she told me about her drama...until my brother came home. i actually stayed there till midnight. we were just talking...which is good cuz i haven't talked to them for a while.

I havent blogged for a while now. Hmmmlets see what I can remember. Last week, Andy and I went to Vegas! We went cuz I read on his cousins blog that they got a room for 10 bucks! Since I love bargains, I checked out their website, and there it was! We went there on a Sunday morning and left Monday afternoon. If you ask me, the room was well worth the $10. Yeahits not the best but its a lot cleaner and better looking than wild wild west---and probably a lot of other hotels out there. Anyway, we had a lot of fun. We even took a side trip to Hoover Dam. To be honest, that place was boring. I was so freakin sleepy during the tour. On the other hand, Andy enjoyed it..even if he lost our new camera bag with a new $60 or $70 battery! Oh well. We finally had a late lunch at some Hawaiian buffet in downtown Vegas. Weve gone there before and I think I remember liking it. But this time was different! It was nasty! So we went to the casinos for a bit! Those 99 cent margaritas made me feel better! Hehe. After downtown, we went back to the strip and just walked around. The following day was the same! We had breakfast at the Excalibur hotel! It was so good. We stopped by State Line on our way home. I won but then lost it again. At least we didnt lose too much money. Well, thats why we didnt buy anything at the outlet. We havent cut Coachs nails for monthsmaybe even a year. We dont know for sure but we think Coach bites her nails. HahaI know that sounds dumb but its not like she has the luxury of running around on cement to file her nails down. We dont walk her every single day either. Well, a few days ago, Coach was on top of Andys lap and its like she was trying to bite her nails. Hehe. I just thought that was funny. Oh yeah, on Friday, Andy and I watched Jersey Girl. I thought it was a good movie! That little girl kind of reminds me of the way I used to be with my parents! So Mean! On Saturday, we helped Andys sister Christine and her friend Sherrie move. They moved out of the apartment that we used to stay in. That place looks a lot worse than when I was living there. Either that or we just never noticed it. People actually left their food outside. Isnt that nasty and rude? Im sure theyre glad to be outta there. Tomorrow, Andy wants us to hang out at his friends house. Im not sure if Im going cuz I actually just wanna stay home! I have to work on another baby shower invitation. Melanis parents are also throwing a shower for them.

i'm still awake! anyway, yesterday, sunday, andy and i went to disneyland....actually california adventure. we went with a few friends. our annual pass is going to expire tomorrow! andy really wants to renew it but i think it's just so freakin' expensive! we were originally supposed to renew it at disneyland but the line was too long...and we didn't wanna wait. we MIGHT just send the form in to renew it. we'll see. since the line was long (and the whole park very crowded), andy and i went over to california adventure. we met up w/ andy's friends. we actually stayed at the park for a long time. we usually just spend an hour or two over there but this time we stayed longer than we normally do. it's probably because one of our friends' cousins came along and she's from japan! we had a lot of fun! their "who wants to be a millionaire" show was cool. you actually have a chance to be in the "hot seat" and win prizes. if you get a million points, you win a disney cruise! so, we watched a few shows and went on a few rides. we went on that one water rapids ride. we saw how soaked a lot of people were from that ride so someone came up with the idea to pay whoever gets wet the most $1 each. (there were a total of 7 people in our group). well, guess who won that money?! I DID! haha...i was soaking! it was fun though.

last sunday, andy and i went to carson AGAIN to give my mom something. well, my mom has been wanted to watch the passions of christ but i guess never found the time or never had anyone to go with or just didn't have a ride. ya, my mom doesn't drive. so, andy and i decided to invite my parents and my aunt to watch it. since it was already a few weeks after it originally came out, i assummed that it wouldn't be as crowded...but i was wrong. we were supposed to go to the 6:30pm or 7:00pm show at rolling hills but by the time we got there, it was all sold out till around 9:30pm. so, we went to the galleria to see if we can get tickets there for the same time...but again, it was sold out! apparently, my mom really wanted to watch it. andy was supposed to take my dad home so that he'll pick the ladies up after the movie but andy....NICE ANDY...said that we ALL should watch it & that he will just go to my parent's house to sleep. he couldn't stay up and watch the movie w/ us cuz he had work the following day. so, yeah, we ended up watch it at 9:40pm. i was so surprised that my mom wanted to watch it that bad. well, everyone liked the movie...cried like babies!

i'm going to carson too many times. i went there on monday to pick my driver's license and some other stuff up and i went there on friday to take my mom to the mall. and later on today, i will be going there AGAIN! i just have to give my mom some paperwork before she leaves for philippines. i think she'll be leaving on tuesday or wednesday. oh well. apparently, a few days ago was girl's day! so, my girlfriends and i got together to hang out yesterday! these girls are actually andy's guy friends' girlfriends! hehe...did that make sense? i knew that since the girls were gonna hang out, the guys wanted to do the same thing! so, we met up at joey & kristina's house in long beach. the girls went out to lunch at some restaurant in long beach (2nd street) while the guys went to the gun range. =) anyway, it was fun hangin' w/ the girls. after lunch, we walked for a bit and looked into a few stores. at one of the stores, i ended up going to the baby section and eventually everyone else came. there were some cute things. there was a tiny ceramic container for baby's first tooth and baby's first curl! all of a sudden, mary said, "you can buy that for my baby!" hehe...that was her way of telling us that she's pregnant! so yeah, she's 3 months pregnant! we were so happy for her! i guess she didn't want to say anything till after she was 3 months pregnant...just incase anything were to happen!! that's also what my brother did. after that, we hung out at the house for a while...then we were off to dinner! we were supposed to eat at some japanese restaurant in torrance/gardena but they only had one room big enough for the 10 of us & it was pretty much reserved. we wanted to go into that room because you take off your shoes & sit on the floor just like in the tatami room in memoirs of a geisha. i even saw some of the workers (girls) wear slippers that reminded me of the slippers from that book! hehe. so, eventually i wanna go back over there and try it out. i went to a restaurant that was similar 2 that in canada but now that i saw this restaurant, it seems like it was more of an authentic japanese cuisine. anyway, we ended up going to a korean bbq place in torrance. it was alright. after dinner, we went to yankee doodle's in long beach to play pool. and that was the end of our night! i was actually supposed to go to carson last night but we left after midnight...which means that my mom was sleeping.

i just bought my first issue of playboy! hehe. no, i'm not turning lesbo! i just wanted to support an old friend, urlLink kay sivilay , since she has a hot 4 page layout in that magazine! =) i haven't seen that girl for a LONG time. if it wasn't for friendster or myspace.com, i wouldn't have known about her modeling success. what's funny is that recently i was cleaning out my closet at my parent's house and found a box filled with letters from my friends back in jr. high/high school. i felt like reminiscing and went through a lot of those letters. and what did i find? i found letters from karouna! hehe...i wont even mention what those letters were about. it's just funny reading my old letters...even embarassing! =) she even remembers writing those letters to me! haha...too funny!

yesterday, andy and i were walking coach to a park close to our place until a lady pulled her car over and said that there was a coyote down the hill. so, we just walked in the opposite direction back home. i hate coyotes! on friday, we went over to national's with my friends to watch the laker game! i'm not into basketball but i just wanted to go to hang out w/ my friends. we went to the one in torrance. i know those places are usually loud but there were these 2 people who kept going at it. one of the guys were for the lakers and the other guy was for the other team (i forgot who they were). it was so irritating and they were even putting each other down. one of em wanted to bet but the other didn't so he just kept making fun of him. haha...so stupid. thank goodness one of the guys left after halftime! anyway, i just liked that place because we went during happy hour...which means half off appetizers and $3 martini's! their martini's were good! after that, we went to my aunt's house to drop off these baby shower things that i made for my cousin's coworker's shower. i'm starting to have a business. hehe. saturday, i decided to get a haircut. i'm not as happy with it cuz it's too short. i just didn't expect that much to be chopped off. i guess i'm just not used to it. oh well. while i was getting my haircut, andy went to long beach to help his friend move. i ended up staying at that hair place longer than expected cuz the person i had an appt. with was running late. the girl that was before me got her hair colored and after she got her hair rinsed, she left cuz she didn't know it was gonna take that long. she didn't even get a hair cut or have her hair blow dried! i was also in a hurry but i still wanted her to fix my hair. =) by the time i got out of there, it was around 5:30pm. melani had another baby shower at her parent's house and it started at 4pm. so, we were late. and besides, they wanted us to pick chinese chicken salad up at the loft which made us even more late. i think melani knows the sex of her baby. before she got the 4d sonogram done, she had a feeling what the baby's sex was going to be. i thought that same thing too until after the sonogram. hehe. so, me, my brother, mel's immediate family, andy, and my immediate family were the only ones who supposedly knew the sex of the baby. well, someone leaked that information out to some coworkers. hehe. so, when they were opening the gifts from the baby shower, they got some clothes that were specific to the baby's sex. most of the other people (who don't know) gave neutral gifts that are good for either a boy or girl. that's why they got a lot of yellow stuff. hehe. so, i think mel and my brother knew that someone told their coworkers and now melani may have an idea of what it is. also, my brother and melani were shopping at potterybarnkids and mel noticed that my brother kept looking at the ********** section. oh well. my parents should be coming back from philippines tomorrow! i'm actually excited. hehe. they've been gone for so long! i think this is the longest vacation they've ever taken. how weird. now i have to finish up my paper that's due tomorrow. yuck!

today my class got cancelled! YAY! since i had some extra time, i decided to go to fry's electronics to buy some stuff. last weekend, andy and i were supposed to go camping in malibu. it didn't happen cuz we found out that it was supposed to rain (which it did) and we totally forgot that we had a family party to go to. oops. i kinda wanna go now before it gets too hot. also, it looks a lot prettier now during spring than it does during summer. since we didn't go, andy got off work a little early and we went to that seafood place in san pedro again. we also walked along the beach! we haven't done that in a long time. all the beaches here are just so freakin' far to just go walking. anyway, on saturday, we went to that one family party. it was my aunt and uncle's birthday and my cousin also got a promotion. she works at csulb doing stuff with their graduate programs...(or something like that) so andy was trying to see if he can get a degree! haha...yeah right. after that party, we went to target to buy stuff we needed. then we were off to andy's friend's house to watch the laker game! i'm not really into the lakers or watching basketball itself (unless i watch it in person) but i just go along with the ride! yesterday, (tuesday), andy and i went to LA cuz we were supposed to watch the sharon osbourne show! hehe. he kinda got home later than expected...but we still decided to give it a try. well, we probably would've made it on time but we couldn't find the street it was on! haha. we weren't too disappointed since we didn't even know who was gonna be on the show. instead, we just drove around for a bit and we went towards beverly center. i haven't been there in so long. andy was really hungry so we had dinner at grand lux cafe! melani told me about that place so we gave it a try. i thought it was gonna be like a regular cafe but it was a really nice restaurant w/ really good food. the owner of that restaurant also owns cheesecake factory. i would go there again! by the time we finished dinner, the mall was closed so we didn't get to walk around. instead, we just went back home.

my easter weekend was kinda hectic! friday: i woke up early and bought a few things at michaels. they had a sale where you get 50% off of anything regular price. i bought some cardstock, scrapbook paper....a few crafty stuff. my brother and melani came over. we just hung out for a bit-- andy also had to help my bro with his computer. we just talked for a while. we also had dinner. we had dinner at a place called california fish and grill. we've passed by that place more than a few times and have always wanted to try it. i thought it was more of a restaurant but it's more laid back. i liked it. their calimari is good! they probably left our place around midnight so after that, andy wanted me to go with him to ronald's house. he had to just check up on their house and feed the dog since they were out of town that weekend. saturday: urlLink we had a little picnic with andy's friends. we all met up at joey's house and headed over to san pedro (ports o call). you basically buy whatever seafood you want (buy by the lb.) you then take your raw food to another station and they cook it up. they add vegetables and potatoes. it's so yummy! the place we got that food at is ghetto though! that's why we had a picnic. i didn't wanna eat in that area. it kinda looks like a swapmeet. hehe. we went over to some park. i forgot what it's called but they usually have those filipino fairs over there. we had a table right by the ocean. it was so NICE and the food was so GOOD! andy and i basically brought the rice, drinks, and whatever else we needed. we knew what we needed cuz we did the same thing with my brother and melani a while back. after our picnic, we headed over to joey's and hung out for a bit. we decided to call justin and kayla to see if they wanted to spend the night with us. they did so we picked them up. my brother asked if we can visit since they wanted to see the kids. we didn't stay that long cuz andy forgot his keys at joey's place. we ended up meeting up at an ice cream place. it's kind of like coldstone. it was so good. i couldn't believe that me and kayla got the same size ice cream (in a waffle cone) and she finished it. i only ate about half of it. i had to get a cup so i can put it in the freezer to eat it again later. haha. so, we finally got home and of course we slept late. they were busy either playing with coach or painting. it was fun but we were tired. sunday: all 4 of us went to the 8am mass. i was surprised at how well they are in waking up in the morning. i thought they'd have a hard time! after mass, we had breakfast at denny's. then we just played games at the house. we were just waiting for time to pass by before we had to go to our next outting. we were going to their uncle's house (maria's side) who happens to live in yorba linda. their house is so nice and huge! i wanna house sit for them one day. hehe. they also have a nice and BIG backyard w/ a NICE view. the kids had a great time with their easter egg hung in their yard. hehe. so, we finally left that party and the kids to go to andy's aunt's house in lakewood. we kinda stayed their longer than expected (since we watched pirates of the carribbean). after that, we went to my brother's house to drop some stuff off. after all that...and all that food, i was so freakin' tired! we finally made it home to watch nick and jessica's variety show...which wasn't all that. i just liked the performance w/ babyface. hehe.

i forgot to post this but last weekend, andy and i went to the pet expo. i actually didn't wanna go but andy did. i was kind of bored but it was alright! hehe! on our way there, i got a text message from my mom! i was like...who the heck is this? i wasn't sure...but it really was my mom. i just thought that was cute. she even asked about coach!

earlier this afternoon, i talked to my brother. he asked if i wanted to go out with him and melani to get their 4D ultrasound done! talk about last minute...their appointment was at 5pm and he told me about an hour and a half before-hand. thanks bro! hehe...well, i still wanted to go. one of my friends got one done and it was quite amazing! so, i guess i wanted to go in for that experience. well, mel's mom got off work early so she was also able to go. since her house was on my way, i picked her up. there was so much traffic! ya, we were late but luckily the people at urlLink first look sonogram were willing to move one of their appointments up. so, we didn't miss anything. we all went into a room with a plasma tv, speakers and a comfortable couch! melani still didn't wanna know the sex of the baby but said it was okay for me, her mom, and my bro to find out...she would just cover her eyes! so, basically the person doing the ultrasound focused a lot more on the baby's face! to me, he/she is already cute! i think most of the time, the baby was sleeping but at one point, he/she stuck his/her tongue out! i just couldn't believe how clear the baby looked! you can even see the baby's movement. so, it was time for melani to close her eyes (put her jacket over her eyes) so that lady can look at the other parts! she basically moved the pointer thingy to show us things and then she typed the sex of the baby on the screen! i kinda got too excited that i made a noise! it didn't really matter what the sex was...i guess i just felt amazed that this thing inside of melani is just so real that i can't wait to meet him/her! anyway, i can't say what the sex of the baby is to anyone...except my parents but they wont be back from philippines till the end of the month! after the sonogram thing, we went to my cousin's house to pick more bottles up (for the other baby shower)!. on our way there, mel's mom was in the car with me and we were just talking about how hard it might be to not say anything about the baby's sex. it's not like we're gonna blab our mouths to anyone...(cuz no one is supposed to know except for immediate family). the reason for that is if we were to tell anyone, melani will be bound to hear it from someone else! that's why they just want the circle to be small so it wont get out! it's just that people like to buy things esp. when they know the sex of the baby! haha...oh well. no point...i guess.

i actually have ONE friend that i've known since jr. high that talks the same and does the same things that we used to do in jr. high. a few months ago, i found all my old letters and read some letters that she wrote to me and realized that even today, she still writes the same as she did in jr. high. i'm not talking about the pitch in her voice or the way she writes. i guess i'm just talking about her attitude. it's like the rest of the people i know...whether it's friends, family, aquaintances, she's the only one that didn't grow up. isn't that sad? well, i guess i should give her a little credit. but still, half the time, i can't believe certain things she does.

on wednesday, i had a test and forgot about it until tuesday night! so, i was studying and readng sooo last minute! hehe...i think i did pretty well! yesterday, the weather was so weird! i remember it was kinda cloudy but didn't even think it was going to rain. i ran a few errands and then i met andy at the house cuz i wanted him to go with me to henry's market. we just wanted to try that place out. so, we went grocery shopping...and when we went out, it was raining so freakin' hard! i was wearing slippers that get VERY slippery when wet so i was holding on to andy. hehe. i need to buy new slippers that don't get slippery! my other slippers that i normally wear (another slippery pair) broke when we went to vegas! oh yeah, i just found out that we may be going to vegas again in two weeks. my friend has been wanting to go (i guess since she hardly has time to go out since she had her baby). so, andy and i might tag-along! our other friend also has a comp'd room! YAY! well, it depends on andy cuz he's still thinking about it. i guess i can still go w/ out him! i would probably just babysit the baby anyway! haha. all i know is that i gotta save my money whether or not we go to vegas.

Looks like I'm going to be a biter because I'm thinking of joining urlLink imagestation Hehe. I was reading Andy's cousin's blog and I guess that's where she stores her pictures. Looks like I'll be a busy bee this weekend. Tomorrow I'll probably be going to Carson to visit my parents. She's been wanting us to go over there to help her look around for a cell phone. After that, we're headed over to Dolphin Park for Gavin's (Grace's kid's) 1st birthday party. He turned one on April 3 and he's barely having his party now! Oh well. He's growing up so fast! The following day, we're headed over to Andy's cousin's graduation party! And on top of that......I'm still waiting for Melani to have her baby! Hehe. Okay, so I have two parties to go to (one on saturday and one on sunday). It doesn't sound like much but I guess I'm thinking that I'll be super busy because I'm just HOPING that the baby will be coming this weekend. Ever since that false alarm, Melani hasn't been going to work and has been walking a lot. That's why she thought she'd give birth by now. Apparantly not! Oh yeah, I want to go out to Coldstone right now! Yummy! =)

So far, we've had one false alarm! Hehe...Melani thought her water broke. They ended up going to the hospital and sure enough, it was a false alarm! Oh well. I've been kind of eager and excited because their due date is this Thursday! It's been almost a month since my car broke down. It's very depressing not having a car...not being able to go out whenever you want. At times, I feel like a kid. Heck, I feel like my mom and aunt too! They both have to rely on someone to drive them around! Well, we haven't gotten the car done for 2 reasons... 1) Ever since we got our transmission flushed at EZ LUBE, the car (transmission) has been acting up & the transmission light would come on. We've gone back there a few times to tell them what's been going on and they told us (several times) to restart the car whenever the transmission light goes on. It resets the sensor in the transmission. He also said that you should restart the engine about 25 times. So, we did what they said. At first the car was fine but I guess the transmission just gave out at the end. We're just waiting to see if they MAY be responsible for the damage and who knows...maybe they'll pay for it...at least some of it! 2) MONEY! I have enough money for what we "think" the problem is but again, we're just waiting to see what EZ LUBE has to say about it. So, for the past few weeks, I haven't been going anywhere since I don't have a car. Andy has just been taking me to school...and the semester just finished last week! =) I'm looking into going back to school for real since no one wants to hire me! =( I'm just worried about money and I guess worried about where to live. I hope that I'll still be qualified for some kind of financial aid. On Friday, my neice, Kalea did a performance at her school. She's so cute. She just turned 6 that same day. She did a performance with her class singing and dancing to a few songs (which included the "chicken dance") and she also did the hula with a different group! That performance was soooo good! After that, we went over to their house for dinner. They just moved into that house so they were happy to have their first guests! =) Anyway, after my brother and Melani left the hospital the day they had their false alarm, my brother called me. I guess he wanted to make sure I was going to be there at the hospital when the baby's born. I already had that on my mind. Heck, I check the answering machine, my voice mail, caller id (almost) constantly! I asked Andy what would happen if Melani was already having the baby...while he was at work. Hehe...he already told his work about it and they're letting him go whenever that time comes...except for Thursday (which is the due date). Haha. Well, at this stage, my brother and Melani are always together. They even carpool to work together. Since they're only using one car, my brother is letting me use his car till the baby comes. It's also so I can run some errands for him while he's in the hospital. Isn't that nice? So, yeah, Andy and I went over to their house tonight so I can pick the car up. Andy ended up leaving Long Beach earlier than I did. I just hung out with my brother for a bit. We even put the carseat in the car. Ummm...I just want someone else to check if we did it right! =)

For the past two days, Andy has been going to the E3 gaming convention at the LA convention center. When he comes home, he's like a little kid that just got back from trick-or-treating on halloween...sorting out his candy! =) He got a lot of goodies and is just so excited! How cute is that?! HeHe!

It was my mom's birthday today. The night before, my brother called me to help him figure out where we should have dinner. Somehow we were on the phone for over an hour! I'm not used to talking to my brother that long! The weird thing is that, when we got off the phone, we still couldn't decide on a specific place! We had a few places in mind but nothing definite. We met with my family at my brother's house in long beach and we were kind of late because Andy was in heavy traffic on his way back from the E3 convention. So, when we got there, I found out that we are eating at a totally different place! We were going to a Filipino restaurant! For some reason, I hate eating at Filipino restaurants! I think it's because I know my mom can cook most of the food...and I guess, I just don't like a majority of Filipino foods...at least at the restaurant! Oh well. It was still a fun dinner but of course, I still didn't like the food (except for the barbecue stick)! I know a lot of people probably think I'm weird for not liking Filipino food...esp. since I'm Filipino! I think the only Filipino foods I like are the certain ones my parents cook! I think it also has to deal with comfort food. For example, Andy can make chicken adobe but it's not as good as when my mom makes it! Weird, I know. Anyway, Melani already packed her suitcase for the hospital. She couldn't decide which outfit the baby should wear on his/her way home. Since she doesn't know the sex of her baby, I told her that I will go ahead and buy the baby his/her first outfit (pink for a girl/blue for a boy)! She didn't want the baby's first outfit just a neutral color (since that's all they have), so I'm kind of excited to buy the baby's first outfit! Did any of that make sense? =) She has about 14 days until her due date!

A video posted Tuesday on an Islamic militant Web site showed the beheading of an American civilian, who identified himself as Nick Berg, in Iraq, and said the execution was carried out by an al-Qaida affiliated group to avenge the abuse of Iraqi prisoners by American soldiers. (AP Photo/Jacqueline Larma). i just saw the entire video of the decapitation of nick berg. it was so disturbing, disgusting, and just plain sad! i haven't really paid much attention to the news lately but i saw a few video stills on tv earlier tonight and andy told me that they beheaded that guy! at first, i couldn't believe it. that is just soooo cruel! andy was trying to look for the video on the net but couldn't find it. so, he was on his way to go to sleep. i decided to look for the video and i found it. andy wanted to check it out too (and i guess i'm glad he was with me) so we watched it. oh gosh, i just felt sick to my stomach but i was still watching it! andy wanted to just close it out but i wouldn't let him. i don't know why...it's really not a good thing to see! and to think....i've been feeling bad for whoever leaves american idol! obviously, there are a lot more bigger and important things to think about in this world!
do you know what happened to those damn lion kings...i mean mountain lions that were in anaheim hills? i hope they're gone!

i just did a blog but somehow it got erased. oh well. anywayz, andy and i ended up getting tickets to the jay leno show w/ the friends cast on the friends set. a few weeks ago, i was on some website and found out that they were giving a certain amount of tickets away on a certain day at a certain time. so, i made sure to be at that website at the right time and that's how i got it. i was only able to get two tix...because they sold out in less than 5 minutes...at least that's what they said! so, andy took a half day so we can go to the show. we got there around 11:30am. when we got there, we had to show them our print out so they can give us the real tickets (it has a # on it so it'll hold our place in line)...and i was surprised cuz no one was there yet. so, we got our tickets and we went out to lunch. we went to a place called dalt's grill. it was so good. we went there at the right time cuz by the time we left, that place was packed! also, when we got back to the place where we got our tickets, there was a huge line. thank goodness our tickets had numbers on it to hold our place in line! i thought that was a good idea so you don't have to always stay in one spot the whole time. anyway, it was so hot that day!! we had to wait a while to get to the studio cuz the shuttles were taking us over there. they basically take you into the studio in sections. on our way there & while we were waiting, we saw nancy o'dell from extra or access. (don't remember). the camera was looking towards us but i don't know if we ended up being on camera though cuz i didn't see the show. did anyone see us? hehe. so, we finally got into the studio! we were finally out of the hot sun! hehe. andy and i got pretty good seats. we were right in the middle! there was a warm up guy giving out friends stuff/tonight show stuff for doing silly things. he wanted people to dance from the back of the audience section to the front. they ended up having a contest and there was this one girl who seemed like she enjoys dancing with poles! haha. it was kinda nasty! also, b4 we even got into the studio, there was this girl w/ huge boobs but for some reason, they were so freakin' low! well, she wanted one of those baby doll shirts and the guy who was giving em out wanted to make sure it fits on whoever he was giving em to. well, that girl wanted it and went to the front (where he was)...she took off her sweater and was just wearing her bra! that was the same girl with the big and low boobs! that was also nasty! i don't mean to be mean but i can't help it. hehe. anyway, b4 the show, jay leno came out for a bit to talk to us. after that, we were able to watch the last episode of friends. i was so sad just cuz they were ending! ya, i guess at times some of the shows from this season and maybe a few others would drag but i was still sad! haha...corny i know. i thought the season finale was pretty good. it was good that everyone was just going on with their lives! there's no need to have a cliff hanger because they're never coming back! =( i wonder if joey's show is gonna be any good. so, the jay leno show was starting and andy and i were on tv for a fraction of a second! did anyone see? haha. after the show, they gave everyone the friends book that's coming out in a few days! it was a long but fun day! friday, andy took the day off. we hung out at the pool for a bit and we went to south coast plaza cuz he had a gift certificate. can you believe we stayed at the mall for 6 hours? andy thinks we were there for 8 hours but i really think it was 6 hours. we hardly ever go to the mall and i guess that's why we took a long time. we were so tired. we were supposed to just stop by the mall to look around really quick and then go to long beach cuz my cousin just got a house over there. well, we didn't get to do that! after the mall, we just had dinner at tokyo lobby! oh well.

geez...i haven't blogged for a while. i guess i've been busy...doing who knows what? last wednesday, after my class, i was on my way to my parent's house to visit...since they just got back from philippines. on my way there, i noticed that something was wrong with my car. so, i decided to pull over and not go to carson anymore. i called andy and (poor him), he left the sports bar (he was watching the laker game) to rescue me! hehe. we ended up just calling AAA to get it towed. so, i didn't get to visit my parents that night. i was kinda sad...can u believe that? so, on thursday morning (around 5am), andy took me to carson b4 he went to work. i basically slept some more when i got there...then hung out w/ my parents. it was cool. andy picked me up with just enough time to go to the asian store, trader joes, kfc, and home for friends! haha...i ended up crying. last friday, andy's friends came over to celebrate his 28th birthday. it was fun. it was cool. hehe...i don't really know what to say about it cuz it's been a while. it was a fun get-together w/ some food and cake! =) saturday was andy's actual birthday. his friends didn't leave till around 3am the night before, so we just slept in and just relaxed most of the time. for dinner, we met up with his family at black angus. after dinner, we went to ikea w/ his family. it was cool. i finally got to ride in their new lexus...hehe. sunday was justin's 1st communion @ st. philomena. i am still SO NOT used to that church...at least the new church. it feels too much like a hall and not a church. i guess it's just not traditional...which is what i miss. the priest talks forever...and when he was announcing the kids' names, a majority of the people at that mass stood up and left. the priest hasn't even ended the mass and blessed everyone. uhh...oh well...that mass took almost 2 hours! we were all starving! and when we got out of the church, it kind of felt like a swap meet. we bought churros! hehe. i know when i was little, the nuns used to sell churros in their garage. i think these are just regular people. monday, tuesday, and wednesday came...and i still have no car. i know it's gonna be really expensive and i don't have that much money. my mom owes me some money, so maybe that'll help me. hehe. i haven't been going anywhere since i have no car. andy just takes me to school.

I just had a looong weekend! First of all, I've been sick for the past few days. On Saturday, Andy was so excited to buy his halo edition xbox! We picked it up that morning at a wherehouse for urlLink mwave.com . Andy also picked up an xbox for my cousin so we also went to Carson. First we stopped by my parent's house but no one was home. We just decided to watch 50 first dates and hang out over there. We were watching the deleted scenes on the dvd and I really really really think my old best friend's dad was in that particular scene (as an extra). I know he was in how stella got her groove back, a home depot commercial, and a popeye's commercial. Well, I'll find out soon enough. Anyway, my throat was killin' me and I wanted a smoothie to soothe my throat, so Andy went to get boba at Tapioca Express while I stayed at the house. Apparently, Andy ran into my parents because the clinic they were at was near Tapioca Express. How weird! My parents were there for a long time! I thought they were just going through a regular check-up. On Friday, my dad started to have chest pains and was sweating really bad. My mom wanted to call 911 but my dad didn't want her too. He just kept saying he was fine. That's why they just decided to go to the clinic. They did an EKG on him and the doctor said it was abnormal and to go to the emergency room. So, they came home and they asked if I can take them to the hospital. I ended up taking them to the hospital while Andy stayed behind for a while because he had to visit my cousin, Glenn. My dad seemed fine.....he was laughing and talking! He seemed normal. When we got to the ER, they took him in right away! They also did an EKG over there and they said that it was 99% abnormal and something needs to be done soon. Apparantly, the doctor said he had a mild heart attack. The next step was to do an urlLink angiogram . Check out the angiogram movie thingy! That's exactly what the doctor told us. There are 3 different ways to fix my dad's heart problem...depending on what the angiogram test tell us. The best and easiest is medication therapy, the middle is the balloon angioplasty/stenting, or the worst case scenario...which is open heart surgery (bypass surgery). Well, he had a blockage on a huge artery! If it were clogged just a little more, he would have a major heart attack! So, yeah, my dad had to have the bypass surgery! This is how it happened! I was in the ER room with my parents when the doctor was telling us all about the angiogram and the 3 different treatments after the test was conducted. I just put it in my head that there were 3 different treatments and I wont think about it until the doctor tells us the results. Keep in mind...I was sick. I was wearing a tank top and a skirt and I was cold! Andy went to Target to buy me some exercise pants & my mom gave me her sweater! The doctor finally came to get my mom and my brother but I didn't go because I happened to be in the bathroom changing!! After a few minutes, they came back out telling us the news...that he has to have bypass surgery. To be honest, I was kind of shocked! I don't know what the risks are but I could tell that my brother was scared! From that moment, I was feeling worse! I was shivering A LOT! They let us see my dad before he was off to surgery. I really don't know what was happening to me. I knew I was sick to begin with but for some reason, it all just got worse! I had to go to the side to catch my breath, to try to stop shaking, and I was actually trying to hold my tears back. It was scary. So, my dad was off to surgery while we stayed in the waiting room. The surgery wouldn't be done for at least 5 hours and I was debating what to do. I was so cold and I was shivering so much. My aunt wrapped me in a blanket! I was not feeling well. So, Andy and I decided to go back home to get just a few hours of sleep! I took my temp. and it was 103! I was drinking lots of fluids and TRYING to get some sleep! Coach was sleeping with me and I think she was dreaming! She was whimpering a lot & for a long period of time! That's how I woke up! I was kind of scared because I thought that was a sign...that my dad's surgery is not going too well! Well, my brother called me around 2:45am telling me that my dad's surgery went well! I felt so much better. I woke Andy up asking him if we can go back. So, we were off to the hospital again. We were able to see my dad and he just looked so uncomfortable. He had stuff going through his body and a tube down his throat. My mom felt so bad for him that she started to cry. I think my dad could sense how nervous my mom was...so my dad kept moving when the nurses didn't want him too! My mom ended up going back to the waiting room and we were just trying to calm my dad down. We all ended up falling asleep in the waiting room. Around 7:30am, my family left while Andy and I stayed behind to see my dad while he was awake. We didn't get to see him until around 9:30am and I was so surprised at how alert he was. He said that he already feels better and stronger! That made me feel good. So, we stayed with him for a while and then we finally went home to Anaheim Hills.

I had a goooood and loooong nap earlier tonight! Andy called in sick today since he's still sick. I went to class this morning and after that, Andy wanted both of us to work on my aunt and uncle's anniversary video. So, we were basically in front of the computer for a looong time!! We promised ourselves to really work at it and if we do a good job, we would reward ourselves with going out to dinner at tokyo lobby! I love that place! =) So, after we met our goal, we were off to dinner. It was so good...but on our way home, I was so tired! Both of us were! We ended up falling asleep. The difference is that I'm awake now while he's still sleeping! I had about 5 hours sleep! That's a lot! My throat is starting to hurt so I'll probably end up getting sick too! On Thursday, we were thinking of going to my cousin's club in Long Beach's Cohiba because Jon B. will be performing! If anyone is interested in going, the info. is below! So, if we're both sick, I don't know if we'll be able to make it! =( I'm not much of a clubbing type of girl but going once or twice a year isn't bad, right? Hehe! Sequence Events presents... Happy belated Father's day! Last night, a friend emailed me through friendster asking me if I had a baby! Haha...nope! That's just my neice! Maya definetely has my brother's color! She's kind of dark! Hehe. On Sunday, Father's day, I went to my brother's house. Andy dropped me off and couldn't stay because he had a cold. He didn't want to get anyone sick especially Maya. So, I was able to hang out with family...mostly cousins! My cousins and I ended up window shopping at Long Beach Towne Center. It was fun. I was trying to look for something cute for baby Maya but couldn't find anything. Oh well. While we were at the house, my cousin called my brother on his cell phone but I decided to pick up the phone. So, we started to chat. He also hasn't been able to find a job for a long time...longer than me! In a few days, he'll be going to Alaska for a month with a few of his friends and he's actually going to try to look for a job there! If he doesn't find anything, he'll be going back home to Chicago in time for "east coast Maya's" first birthday and in September, he's going to drive here and just stay here! He's so brave. My cousins, and Andy are trying to look out for positions for him. Later, my dad asked me if I was still looking for a job. I said yeah, but I might move to Chicago to look for a job over there. He just laughed and said, you move to Chicago while Steve moves here?! =) I actually would. I'm the type of person that would "probably" move as long as I find a good job...even if it was in Chicago. But in my case, I feel STUCK! It's not like I can go out of the state for months at a time to look for a job. I don't have that kind of money...my parent's don't either! Oh well. I'm still trying to figure myself out! But for now, I'm still a loser who wants to go back to school but wants all the financial aid in the world!

Last weekend was Justin's 8th birthday. Andy has been wanting to get him a left handed golf club set for a while now...it's just that, it's too darn expensive! Well, my brother and Melani thought it was also a good idea.......so we split the cost! =) Now, Justin has his own set and Andy can play with him. I know Andy enjoys the sport but I don't know if he's actually good at it! Hehe. Needless to say, he's going to have to give Justin (and my brother) some lessons! =) So, Justin's party was on Saturday and it was the first time Maya spent some time at someone else's house. They weren't even planning on staying at the party for a long time because they thought it was gonna be really crowded. Apparently, it wasn't crowded at all. They practically stayed the whole night...but most of their time was spent upstairs. Right before we left for Justin's party, Andy and I heard the news about Reagan's death. I was kind of shocked. So sad. I'm not much of a politics girl (had to take that class twice...hehe) but Reagan was my first president. I know Carter was the president when I was born, but Reagan was the first president I ever knew. Sunday, Andy went to Corona to help his friend with some landscaping...in his backyard. The following day, Monday, I woke up around 9am and Andy was still home. He usually leaves for work by 5:30am. He ended up calling in sick because his hands were hurting from working in the backyard! So, we were just watching the news regarding Reagan's death...(bringing his body from the mortuary to his presidential library). I mentioned that we should go to his library or visit his star in Hollywood...but he just laughed! hehe. I also mentioned that I wanted to go to some craft store in LA. He said that he'd rather go to Simi Valley to see Reagan! So, we were off! First, we had lunch around 3:30pm at Black Angus in Cerritos. After that, we were off to Simi Valley. The traffic wasn't too bad until we got really close to the exit! It felt like forever! So, we parked at Moorpark College and saw A LOT of people! I had to use the restroom really bad and when we pulled into the parking lot, I saw A LOT of portopotties! I was scared because I've never used one of those things and I didn't intend to. I knew there were other restrooms because we were in a school! So, I went and the next obstacle was to find the end of the line! It took us a while...it was so freakin' long! It was at the back of the school and the line snakes around several times! When we got in line, we noticed it was moving pretty fast. But then there was a lady that was passing by that just came from the library and she was estimating our wait to be about 7 hours! We didn't really believe it because the line was moving fast! But boy...was she right! The line was still moving in a steady pace and that's why, at first, it didn't seem like we were waiting for a long time! That changed when we got closer to the front of the school. That felt SOOOO long and by that time, it was around midnight, and it was getting so cold. When Andy and I planned on going out there, we were estimating our wait to be around 3 hours! haha. So WRONG! We were so anxious when we were going through security and getting on the bus! We probably didn't get to the library till around 2:45am. Once we got to the library, everyting was moving pretty fast! It was an experience I'll never forget! On our way to the library (on the bus), we passed by a HUGE memorial for Reagan that just gave me chills. It was beautiful! I couldn't believe that we were able to get so close to him! We were a lot closer than the people at Washington DC. I don't know if I'll say it was worth the wait...but I don't regret it! It's a cool thing to experience...and you get to meet people! We were so tired! Andy wanted me to drive home but I asked him if he can just drive just out of the traffic zone because I didn't want to be directed by those people on the street! I'm always afraid I'm not gonna see them and run them over! hehe. Well, that almost happened when Andy was driving. The guy was telling him to stop and Andy had to stop really hard! We didn't even say anything to each other. We were just zombies. We talked about it later. So, after the traffic zone, he pulled over so I can drive. I was eating candy and singing! =) We finally got home around 5:30am! We couldn't bring any cameras in the library so I was planning on taking some pictures at the school. They had a few memorials that I wanted to take pictures of. But by the time we got back, I forgot! Let me say it again...we were so tired! hehe. Andy ended up calling in sick again!

I'm back from my busy weekend! =) Saturday: On Saturday morning, my brother called telling us that they're in the hospital & asked if we can get there soon because Mel was already dilated at 9 sonometers (usually 10 sonometers is when birth occurs). So, I had to get ready really fast. Andy was walking Coach so that kind of held us back. Luckily, I had everything that I needed to take (baby's clothes, gifts, camera, etc.) ready the night before so all we had to do was take a shower, get ready, and leave! On our way to the hospital, I called Grace because her son was having a party and I was supposed to be there early to help out. I just told her that I probably wont make it but that I'll try! When we got to the hospital, my parents, Justin, Kayla, & their parents, and Mel's mom and brother were already there! My cousin ended up staying in the delivery room to help out since she's a nurse that delivers babies! From what I hear, Mel was so thankful to have her there because she just helped make things easier. Otherwise, she probably would've killed my brother. Hehe. So, they had a baby girl. Mel said she honestly thought she was having a boy! They named her Maya. She was born at 10:44am weighing 6 lbs 12 oz. and is 20 inches. Mel asked if I wanted to hold her, so I did. I was kind of scared at first but I did hold her. I held her a few times and I was playing with my mom because I wouldn't give Maya to her. Hehe. Anyway, we decided to leave the hospital to give the new parents some rest. We had to run some errands for my brother and after that, we decided to go to Gavin's birthday party! It was cool to hang out with my friends. Poor Gavin was sick so he didn't look happy. There was a clown that looked so creapy and had a bad accent. She was talking to the kids and at times, it seemed like they weren't paying attention! The clown even asked, "Hey, do you hear me?" Haha. It was funny. She did a bad job with painting faces and making those balloon animals. I don't know how they ended up with that clown! Oh well. =) We pretty much stayed there until they were putting the tables away. Grace's dad gave me so much cake...supposedly for me and my dad! (my dad and Grace's dad are friends too). The party had a sports theme....and it was pretty much LAKER'd out! So, Grace gave me a few purple and yellow balloons to bring to the hospital! =) After the party, we went to the store to buy some flowers and one of those "it's a girl" mylar balloons. We went back to the hospital to drop it off but they didn't let us take in the purple/yellow balloons because they were latex! Oh well. Sunday: We stopped by the hospital (again) for about 30 minutes. We dropped off those miniature hershey chocolates because I made a "birth announcement" label for the candies! Apparently, it was a big hit because the grandparents are asking me to make more. After our short visit, we headed over to BJ's in Cerritos for Andy's cousins' graduation party! That place was pretty cool! It was huge! So, we stayed there for a while. After that, I think we went to the hospital again. We try to stay there in 30 minute increments because if you're there for Monday: Maya's first day at home We went over to Rod and Mel's house in Long Beach because some people were coming over and my dad was going to have a barbecue. We hung out there for a while. I was feeling so bad for Melani and Maya. The baby was crying a lot and the grandmas were just trying to tell Melani what to do....things that she's not supposed to do. So, when cousin Maria (the nurse who delivers babies) came over, my brother was telling her to reinforce some of the things she should and shouldn't do. But did that work? NO! It's like the grandmas don't like to hear anything! Oh well. Poor Melani. If I were in Melani's position, I would probably be crying. Anyway, I helped clean everything up so we can all leave and let the new family get their rest. And that was that!
